lesson: Unit 6 - Discussing Personal Strengths and Weaknesses Quiz

questions.question: Why is it important to understand your strengths and weaknesses?
answers: To grow and make better decisions.
questions.correct: To grow and make better decisions.

questions.question: What is a strength?
answers: A skill or quality you do well.
questions.correct: A skill or quality you do well.

questions.question: Why is it important to acknowledge weaknesses?
answers: To understand where you can improve.
questions.correct: To understand where you can improve.

questions.question: What can a weakness help you do?
Which of these is an example of a strength?
What is a way to turn a weakness into a strength?
Why should you ask others for feedback?
answers: To understand how others see your strengths and weaknesses.
questions.correct: To understand how others see your strengths and weaknesses.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a strength?
Why is knowing your strengths valuable for a career?
answers: It helps you find roles that suit you.
questions.correct: It helps you find roles that suit you.

questions.question: Why is accepting your weaknesses helpful?
answers: It allows you to seek help and improve.
It means you have to fail.
It means you can ignore them.
questions.correct: It allows you to seek help and improve.

questions.question: What is an example of a strength for teamwork?
Why is it important to review your strengths periodically?
What is a benefit of working on your weaknesses?
What can help you discover hidden strengths?
answers: Doing the same thing every day.

questions.question: Why is it helpful to set goals related to strengths and weaknesses?
answers: To make a plan for growth.
questions.correct: To make a plan for growth.
